title: Fire causes heavy damage at house in Montgomery County, fire department says
text:
Fire caused hundreds of thousands of dollars in damage and displaced three people Tuesday morning at a house in the Fairland area of Montgomery County, the fire department said.

The blaze broke out about 5 a.m. in a two-story house in the 13600 block of Creekside Drive, the fire department said. They said it may have been caused by a dehumidifier under the sink in a rented space in a basement kitchen.

Damage was estimated at $400,000, the fire department said. Two adults and a child were displaced.

One cat died from injuries suffered in the fire, the department said.

description: Three displaced in Fairland fire, officials say.
